text: The Terry Fox Story is an Canadian-American biographical movie. It was released on May 22, 1983 in North America. It was directed by Ralph L. Thomas. Principal photography for the movie started on August 23, 1982 and ended on October 14, 1982. The movie cost USD$2,400,000 to make. The movie focuses on the life of Terry Fox, an amputee athlete and cancer research activist. It follows Fox's Marathon of Hope run as he travels from St. John's, Newfoundland across Canada to help raise money for cancer research. == Cast == * Eric Fryer as Terry Fox * Robert Duvall as Bill Vigars * Chris Makepeace as Darrell Fox * Rosalind Chao as Rika Noda * Michael Zelniker as Doug Alward * Elva Mai Hoover as Betty Fox * Frank Adamson as Rolly Fox * Marie McCann as Judith Fox ==Reception== The movie recieved mixed and positive reviews from critics.Base, Ron (May 27, 1983). "Terry Fox movie scores as a true-grit tearjerker". Toronto Star. D1. Fox's family did not like the movie because of the way they made Terry to be short-tempered. The movie won in six categories at the 5th Genie Awards. It won Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Supporting Actor, Best Sound, Best Sound Editing, and Best Film Editing. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1983 movies Category:1983 drama movies Category:1980s biographical movies Category:American biographical movies Category:American sports movies Category:Canadian biographical movies Category:Canadian drama movies Category:English-language movies Category:Movies about disabilities Category:Movies based on real life events Category:Television movies
